projects.title: Factories Creating Emissions
projects.description: Este projeto explora as emissões de gases de efeito estufa atribuíveis a produtos, levando em conta a geração de calor necessária para a fabricação e transporte. Com base em dados públicos da nature.com, o projeto utiliza informações sobre a pegada de carbono de produtos (PCF) medindo o equivalente em CO2 para diferentes estágios da produção, desde a extração de matérias-primas até a operação e o uso final. Usando uma base de dados PostgreSQL com a tabela 'product_emissions', a análise identifica o número de empresas únicas e a pegada de carbono total por grupo de indústria para o ano mais recente. A consulta SQL aplicada permite filtrar, agrupar e ordenar os dados, revelando quais setores possuem as maiores emissões e contribuindo para estratégias de manufatura sustentável. (Crédito da imagem: Maxim Tolchinskiy via Unsplash)

projects.title: Golden Age of Video Games Analysis
projects.description: Video games are big business: the global gaming market is projected to be worth over $300 billion by 2027. In this project, you'll analyze critic and user scores along with sales data for the top 400 video games released since 1977. The goal is to discover if a 'Golden Age' of video games exists by identifying the best-rated release years and by investigating the business side through best-selling titles. You will join multiple datasets—including game_sales, reviews, users_avg_year_rating, and critics_avg_year_rating—and use filtering, grouping, ordering, and set theory techniques in SQL to extract actionable insights on market trends.

projects.title: Sports Apparel Analysis
projects.description: Analyzes product data from an online sports apparel retailer by merging multiple datasets to explore pricing strategies and consumer engagement. The project categorizes products into 'Budget', 'Average', 'Expensive', and 'Elite' based on listing price quartiles, calculates mean revenue for Adidas and Nike, and examines the relationship between product description lengths and average ratings using Python, pandas, seaborn, and matplotlib. This comprehensive analysis provides actionable insights for optimizing marketing strategies and improving revenue streams.

projects.title: Online Shopping Purchase Analysis
projects.description: Analyzes online shopping session data to understand consumer behavior during the busiest shopping months (November and December). The project calculates purchase rates by customer type, investigates correlations among page durations, and forecasts the likelihood of achieving sales targets under a new marketing campaign using SQL queries and Python visualizations.

projects.title: International Debt Analysis
projects.description: Analyzes international debt data collected by The World Bank to explore economic debt trends in developing countries. The project answers key questions such as the number of distinct countries, identifying which country has the highest debt, and which has the lowest principal repayments using SQL queries on a PostgreSQL database.

projects.title: Mental Health Analysis of International Students
projects.description: Explores whether studying abroad affects students' mental health based on data from a 2018 survey at a Japanese international university. The project investigates depression scores, social connectedness, acculturative stress, and examines whether the length of stay influences mental health difficulties, using PostgreSQL for data exploration.

projects.title: Super Bowl Data Analysis
projects.description: Analyzed data from 52 Super Bowls held until 2018 to explore TV viewership trends, game outcomes, and halftime musical performances. The analysis revealed that TV viewership has consistently grown, blowouts are rare, and halftime shows are a spectacle in their own right, with standout performances by artists like Justin Timberlake.

projects.title: Lego Licensed Sets Analysis
projects.description: Analyzed the impact of licensed sets on Lego’s portfolio by focusing on the Star Wars franchise. The project revealed that 50% of licensed sets belong to Star Wars and identified 2016 as the peak release year. Data processing and analysis were performed using pandas (with optional numpy support) and pivot tables to extract key trends.

projects.title: SEM Campaign Builder for Furniture Retail
projects.description: Generated 930 exact/phrase match keywords targeting budget shoppers - excluded 17 luxury terms, prioritized 45 discount modifiers ('sale', 'cheap'). Structured 5 ad groups with product-keyword combinations.

projects.title: LCK Spring 2024 Esports Analytics
projects.description: Built 3 relational datasets from 1.2k matches: tracked 45 KPIs (KDA=4.2 avg, 63% win rate thresholds). Automated web scraping with Selenium/BeautifulSoup.

projects.title: LoL Esports Predictive Engine
projects.description: Developed & maintained 3+ years ML system: 68% match prediction accuracy (LCK/LCS/LEC). Processed 10k+ matches with 42 features (draft picks, obj timings, meta shifts). Daily Excel automation + Python retraining.

projects.title: Sales Pipeline Debugging
projects.description: Resolved 3 critical data issues: Tax calculation rounding errors (0.1% discrepancy), dynamic threshold validation for Total (±3σ), and NaN handling in 4.7% of Condition_1 checks. Achieved 100% data validation.

projects.title: EV Charging Network Optimization
projects.description: Identified 37% coverage gaps in rural areas, optimized fast-charger placement (150kW+ nodes), and correlated 92% EV adoption-growth with urban infrastructure. Processed geospatial + usage data from 5 government datasets.

projects.title: Sleep Health Risk Analysis
projects.description: Identified high-risk groups: Sales Reps (lowest sleep=5.8h, quality=4.2/10) & overweight/obese BMI (43%/40% insomnia rates). Analyzed 374 entries with occupation/BMI segmentation.

projects.title: Netflix Content Trends Analysis
projects.description: Processed 8k+ titles data: identified top genres (Drama/Comedy), analyzed release year trends (2015-2020 peak), compared movie/show ratios (70% movies).

projects.title: NYC School SAT Analysis
projects.description: Identified top 10 math schools (score >640), calculated total SAT averages, compared borough performance. Tools: Python, Pandas for data processing.

projects.title: Nobel Prize Trends Visualization
projects.description: Analyzed 900+ laureates: mapped category dominance (Physics/Medicine), country rankings (US/UK/DE), temporal trends (1901-2020), gender distribution (6% female).

projects.title: LA Crime Pattern Analysis
projects.description: Identified peak crime hour (12h), top high-risk area (Central), and vulnerable age group (26-34 bracket). Processed 180k+ records with time conversion and age-binning.

projects.title: Digital Fitness Demand Analysis
projects.description: Quantified COVID-19 impact: 300% home vs gym search growth (2020-2022). Key markets: US (score=85), Philippines leads SEA. Tools: Pandas time-series, multi-dataset merge.

projects.title: Avocado Supply Chain Optimization
projects.description: Identified cost drivers: logistics (38% of total), seasonal price variance (±22%), Mexico dependency (72% imports). Merged 4 datasets (suppliers/transport/prices) with outlier handling.
